notes: Four events. On both 16 and 17 November 2019, clashes between FARDC and Ugandan ADF rebels were reported in the ADF strongholds of Chochota, 12 km northeast of Oicha, and of Mapubu in Bumbuba-Kisiki, Nord-Kivu. FARDC claimed to have taken control of Mapubu quarry on 16 November and Mapubu 3 on 17 November, and of Chochota valley and surrounding areas on 17 November, two days after claiming the control of "Chute de Chochota" (a total of 7 strategic locations were reportedly taken over). Two ADF leaders and other rebels were reported killed (unknown reported fatalities coded as 10), along with 4 FARDC soldiers; 14 fatalities spread across four events. *Note that FARDC launched operations in the area on 30 October.

assoc_actor_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On 16 November 2019, a week after a similar event was reported, 35 combatants from different armed groups - Kirikicho, Ngubito, Karume, and Rwandan FDLR and CNRD - reportedly handed themselves over, along with 7 war weapons, to a delegation of provincial deputees in Ziralo city of Kalehe territory, Sud-Kivu.

On 16 November 2019, three suspected murderers - including one suspected of being a Burundian FNL member - were reportedly beaten to death by angry youths on the Nyamutiri-Lemera road in the territory of Uvira, Sud-Kivu, after the killing of two women on 15 November - not included in the dataset as it was seemingly of a criminal nature only. [size=no report]

On 16 November 2019, former chief of sector of Bene Dibele in Kole territory, Sankuru, Lopeto Andre, reportedly organised an "anger march" in Bene Dibele in response for his suspension from his position. People were reported injured as demonstrators, some of whom were allegedly carrying machetes, started to engage in vadalism. [size=no report]

source: Politico (DRC); La Prunelle; Radio Okapi; Actualite
notes: On the early morning of 16 November 2019, Ugandan ADF rebels reportedly carried out an incursion in the town of Mbau, 20 km north of Beni in Nord-Kivu, and killed 8 citizens in Mbau-centre, Madinda and Kebi Keba neighbourhoods (5 women and 3 men). After setting a house on fire, they left the city and carried out an incursion in a Pygmy camp near Mbau, in Mambalasa in Bololoma locality, where they killed between 6 and 8 depending on sources. (coded as two separate events).

On 16 November 2019, a number of students and residents of Kansasa in Bakua Mulumba Tshilehu chieftaincy of Lomami province reportedly set on fire the area's school and looted the houses of its director and several teachers, holding them accountable for the death by drowning of two students. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Filimbi Movement
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 16 November 2019, LUCHA activists held a sit-in in the centre of Kavumu city, Sud-Kivu, asking for the removal of a police container currently on a roundabout of the city. Police forces intervened and dislodged demonstrators, allegedly beating up a number of them in the process. [size=no report]
On 16 November 2019, hundreds of students and Katana residents reportedly took to the streets of Katana in Kabare territory, Sud-Kivu, to denounce the rampant insecurity in the area. [size=100]

actor1: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
notes: On the late evening of 16 November 2019, around ten suspected CODECO assailants reportedly attacked the village of Dzudda in Ndo-Okebo chieftancy of Djugu territory, Ituri, killing 2 people and injuring at least 3 others before looting the local night market, setting several houses on fire, and allegedly kidnapping 10 citizens. A third citizen later died in the hospital.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
source: 7 Sur 7; Radio Okapi; Actualite; Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo
notes: Four events. On both 16 and 17 November 2019, clashes between FARDC and Ugandan ADF rebels were reported in the ADF strongholds of Chochota, 12 km northeast of Oicha, and of Mapubu in Bumbuba-Kisiki, Nord-Kivu. FARDC claimed to have taken control of Mapubu quarry on 16 November and Mapubu 3 on 17 November, and of Chochota valley and surrounding areas on 17 November, two days after claiming the control of "Chute de Chochota" (a total of 7 strategic locations were reportedly taken over). Two ADF leaders and other rebels were reported killed (unknown reported fatalities coded as 10), along with 4 FARDC soldiers; 14 fatalities spread across four events. *Note that FARDC launched operations in the area on 30 October.

09 May 2019. During the night, ADF forces looted  Mangboko, Oicha according to local sources. The assailants also shot and injured a 16 year old.

actor1: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor2: Bafulero Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Banyindu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mtetezi Militia
notes: 09 May 2019. Communal clashes continued between the Ngumino and the Banyindu and Bafuliru (in alliance with or under the leadership of Mtetezi) in the Tanganyika region of Fizi and neighboring Minembwe. During the clashes, the villages of Kamombo, Kabara, Oma, and Alumya (no coordinates available) were burned. Many locals were displaced by the communal violence following the murder of a Banyindu chief on 04/05.
On 5 September, in Goma, an unspecified number of workers protested demanding payment of salaries from SMB for the past 5 months. [size=no report]

notes: 08 May 2019. During the night, several prisoners escaped from Kananga prison, which has been under the control of the prisoners since 22 April. Police forces fired warning shots and captured some of the escapees. On 10/05, three prisoner bodies were discovered nearby, suspected of being killed during the escape. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
assoc_actor_2: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: 08 May 2019. Two groups of UDPS party supporters fought with each other in Limete. The groups threw projectiles at each other. Police intervened with tear gas to disperse the groups. [size=no report]

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 08 May 2019. A suspected Mayi Mayi militia launched an attack in Butembo, reportedly in an attempt to free a captured combatant at a local hospital. The attackers killed one police officer who was guarding the facility. The FARDC responded and clashed with the attackers. The military reported seven fatalities on the attackers side, while city officials reported a dozen.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 8 May, in Djugu, an unidentified armed group attacked the FARDC. 4 FARDC officers were killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

An unidentified armed group, reportedly with support from a South Sudanese militia, attacked the FARDC in Muganga location of Bahema-Nord chieftancy, Djugu territory by the shores of Lake Albert (coded at Blukwa, chief-city of Bahema-Nord). At least two soldiers were killed, with some sources indicating five.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: 07 May 2019. An unidentified armed group, consisting of approximately 100 fighters, attacked Blukwa, Djugu (some sources report the attack occurred in the Lea village). The FARDC contingent in the town was outnumbered and did not engage the attackers. The assailants killed at least two children (some sources report three). They also burned five homes, killed livestock, and pillaged the village. MONUSCO forces intervened and repelled the attackers.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 May 2019. Unidentified perpetrators set the Katwa hospital's triage center on fire.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 May 2019. The ADF attacked an FARDC base in Bunduguya (coordinates are approximate base on location 7 km north of Kamango). Two people were killed during the clashes. The attackers looted the town, according to local civil society organization. Residents of the Kamango area have fled.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 06 May 2019. An unidentified armed group and the FARDC clashed in the Wago forest (located in the Laudjo groupment). Local sources reported, nine soldiers were captured.

06 May 2019. Students from the Higher Institute of Arts demonstrated in Kinshasa, calling for the resignation of the general director and resumption of classes. Classes have been suspended since April due to an on-going faculty strike, calling for the dismissal of the general director of the school. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

The FARDC responded and the groups clashed throughout the day. Three civilians were wounded and several remain missing. The military reported the attackers were the same group, which had attached Tshabi, Ituri.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 05 May 2019. The UPLC killed a female youth in Malando, Beni (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map) after she was accused of witchcraft.

04 May 2019. The ADF attacked Mulango (no coordinates available, located south of Irumu). According to witnesses, the assailants injured civilians and looted property. They also abducted an unspecified number of civilians.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 04 May 2019. A soldier, who was responsible for guarding an estate owned by Kabila in Mbobero, Kabare (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map), shot and killed a civilian while attempting to extort him.

03 May 2019. An unidentified group of people burned an elderly man to death in Katenga, Fizi. The attack reportedly stemmed from  witchcraft accusations.

03 May 2019. LUCHA activist protested in front of the Airtel office in Goma. The organization denounces the communication service providers fees and refusal to utilize geolocation technology to locate kidnappers. [size=no report]

02 May 2019. The ADF abducted 10 people from Tondoli, Ituri, reported local government officials.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

29 April 2019. Doctors demonstrated in Kisangani, demanding their risk premiums from the government. [size=no report]

A motor-taxi driver broke through the barricaded road, and other motorcyclist followed. The students and motorcyclists began throwing rocks at each other. The motorcyclists also damaged property at the ISP Gombe institute. [size=no report]

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Prison Guards
notes: 22 April - 06 May 2019. Prisoners took control of the central prison of Kananga and refused access to guards and administrators into the facility. During the night of 06/05, an unknown number escaped the prison, including Kamonia Nsapu elements. The suspects on trial for the murder of the UN experts were also among the escapees. Those who remained continued to prevent prison officials from entering the facility. [size=no report]

22 April 2019. Angolan military forces entered Kiphese, Lukula (no coordinates available). The security forces were searching for FLEC rebels. During their incursions, which occurred at least twice during April, the forces detained at least four people who they took back to Angola.

21 April 2019. Raia Mutomboki Shabani and Raia Mutomboki Butachibera clashed in Ngokwe (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map), after a disagreement during a meeting between the armed groups. Three Shabani and four Butachibera combatants were killed.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor2: Bosozaya Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 April 2019. Following the ruling on a land dispute between the Bosonalongo and Bosozaya villages in the Kungu territory, a group of Bosonalongo residents armed with traditional weapons attacked Bosozaya, Kungu (no coordinates available) and clashed with local residents. Three Bosozaya were seriously injured and one Bosonalongo attacker was slightly injured. The attackers burned 43 homes, two schools, and destroyed agricultural fields.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 20 April 2019. An FARDC patrol attacked the Raia Mutombi Walike, after they looted Tchankindo (coordinates not known).

20 April 2019. Angolan military forces entered Makanga, Lukula (no coordinates available). The security forces were searching for FLEC rebels. During their incursions, which occurred at least twice during April, the forces detained at least four people who they took back to Angola.

notes: 19 April 2019. A suspected Mayi Mayi group attacked the Catholic University of Graben's Clinic in Butembo, which operates as part of the WHO's Ebola response. The assailants killed a Cameroonian doctor and burned a vehicle. According to a witness, the assailants claimed Ebola was not real and the doctors were killing people by claiming it was.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: 19 April 2019. Intelligence officers arrested a woman carrying 23 magazines of ammunition and 690 cartridges in Mulongwe, Uvira. The woman was detained while boarding a bus to Fizi, with the ammunition hidden in her luggage.
18 April 2019. Miners in Rubaya demonstrated against Bisunzu Mining, for not paying the miners for the mineral. The demonstrators also denounced harassment by security officers. [size=no report]

18 April 2019 (on or before). Kabue Ditunga (aka 'General'), who had voluntarily disarmed after the 2018 presidential elections, recruited five male youth in Kananga. Ditunga (who is armed), along with the youth, extort the civilian population of Kananga.

Mayi Mayi militiamen killed a doctor in the University's clinic the next day (coded in separate event).

notes: 18 April 2019. The FARDC launched operations in the Djugu territory to remove barriers, which soldiers established along roads to extort the local population.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

16 April 2019. During the week, likely clash between Gumino and armed Burundian militia (likely FNL or FOREBU which are aligned and active in the region) after they killed a local chief from Basmiukindji, Itombwe (no coordinates available) (coded separately). 15 April 2019. Youth from Lokenye neighborhood of Lodja targeted four facilities of the Catholic Church in Lodja, including two schools. They stole goods and attempted to set some of the facilities on fire. The Catholic Church was opposed to the single candidate elections in Sankuru. [size=no report]

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 April 2019. An unidentified armed group looted homes in Nyange, Fizi (coordinates not known). The assailants abducted several men to carry the stolen goods.

End of March - April. Over 12,000 people were displaced in the Kibele region of northern Beni (no coordinates available). Most of the IDPs fled to Kamango and Nobili, which can only be accessed through Uganda due to the insecurity of the region in DRC. Over 60,000 people have reportedly been displaced in North Kivu, particularly the Beni territory during the month of April. Some of the displaced are crossing into Uganda through informal crossings, bypassing immigration and health officials. Humanitarian actors are concerned about the spread of Ebola and access to assistance for those crossing informally.
15 April 2019. An angry mob assaulted a man in Butembo for going to the bathroom in a public area. The mob accused him of spreading Ebola. [size=no report]
15 April 2019. The Mayi Mayi Reunion attacked Munene, Fizi. The assailants abducted a man and looted money, livestock, and other goods.
15 April 2019. LUCHA and other civil society organizations demonstrated in Goma against harassment by the provincial government and the customs office. [size=no report]

Most of those abducted civilians were released on 5 March.

assoc_actor_2: Luba Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 19 February 2019. Bana Mura combatants attacked and killed 15 Luba civilians, including six women, in Tshiniota, Kasai (no coordinates available). The attack followed broadcasts by Chokwe journalists on radio stations calling for violence.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 19 February. Approximately 300 police officers demonstrated in Gbadolite over three months of back payments owed to them.

19 February. Residents of the Gyamba neighborhood in Bukavu barricaded Road 2, which leads from Bukavu through the Ruzizi border crossing, for a second day. The residents protested the cut off of their water supply four months prior. [size=no report]

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

Military forces intervened to restore order.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

18 February. Mayi Mayi Buhirwa ambushed two passenger vehicles in Rushima (no coordinates available, located between Kiliba and Uvira). The assailants looted the property of the passengers.

notes: 15 February. Angry residents attacked a hand washing station - a part of the Ebola response - in Mambasa, Ituri. The residents opposed the Ebola vaccination campaign and were angry that locals were not hired as part of the response. Soldiers and police responded by firing into the air to disperse the group. A woman was injured by a stray bullet.

assoc_actor_2: FCC: Common Front for Congo; CCU: United Congolese Convention
notes: 12 February. Justin Omookala, of the CCU, held a governorship campaign march in Lusambo, Sankuru. Youth from the FCC opposition threw rocks at the CCU members. Some sources indicate that the groups began street fighting and the police intervened with live ammunition, killing one and injuring others. However, other sources reported that Justin Omookala's bodyguard shot at the opposition, resulting in the death and injuries.

08 February 2019. Raia Mutomboki- Kokodikoko attacked Kabikokole, Mwenga (coordinates are approximate). The assailants reportedly raped 100 women. They also looted the town and burned a health center.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 February (on or around). The corpse of a woman was found in Ariwara, Ituri. The victim's genitals had been removed. Some locals believe the genitals were removed for ritualistic purposes.

notes: 07 February. Students at the University of Kisangani, who rioted over the arrest of two students the day prior, continued to destroy property. The students attacked professor's homes and property. One woman was reportedly assaulted by the rioters.

The FARDC reportedly repelled the attackers (clash coded separately) but residents reported hearing gunfire into the next morning. At least four civilian fatalities were reported (other sources indicated seven). The attackers also looted civilian property and abducted four adults and four children - the body of one of the abductees was found near Bwerera a few days later.

The NDC-Renove clashed with Nyatura-Nzayi in Munongo and Kakonse (no coordinates available), as the Nyatura-Nzayi are trying to take control of Lwama (coordinates are approximate based on OCHA map) from the NDC-Renove. Four Nyatura combatants, two NDC-Renove fighters and two civilians were killed during the clashed.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 04 February. Residents of the Keshero neighborhood of Goma caught a robber and police intervened to prevent the mob from attacking the robber. One police officer opened fire on the crowd of locals trying to disperse the mob, killing a teenage girl and injuring two male youths.

assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 04 February. Members of the RTNC protested in front of the African Union headquarters in Kinshasa, demanding contract renegotiations and the resignation of Ernest Kabila, the director of the public media company.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 03 February. Following the murder of a civilian by a soldier in Yamokolo, the victims family brought the body to the territorial administrative office. Upon learning of the incident, Basoko residents gathered to protest the killing. Military forces opened fire to disperse the demonstrators, but ran out of ammunition. At which point, the mob attacked a soldier and burned him alive. The group also ransacked the police station and freed nine detainees.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 03 February (on or before). An armed group ambushed and robbed a bus traveling from Bukavu to Uvira near Rutemba, Sud Kivu. Nine civilians were injured during the attack.

notes: 03 February. A soldier shot and killed a civilian in Yamokolo, Basoko.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

notes: 03 February. A female prisoner was whipped 100 times after refusing advances from the prison director. The prisoner was transferred to a hospital for medical treatment.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: 01 January. Residents of Kindu demonstrated against increased insecurity in the city, following the murder of a merchant the day prior. The demonstrators suspect police forces are behind the insecurity and attacked the Kindu police station. Police forces responded with tear gas and live ammunition. Two students were shot, according to Radio Okapi they were killed while Actualite reported they were injured. The demonstrators also attacked a radio station, where a police officer was hiding. Military forces were deployed to restore order.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 28 January - 02 April: The FARDC launched operations against the Mayi Mayi Simba in the Babila Babombi and Bombo communes of Mambasa territory. 38 Mayi Mayi Simba were killed during the period. 12 are coded in Mapendano on 01/03. The remaining 26 fatalities are spread between 8 events during the time period (one battle per week).

28 January. LRA combatants looted two travelers 11 km northeast of Bilikwa, Haut-Uele. They also looted another traveler 6 km northeast of Bilikwa. The assailants held the men hostage for a few hours before releasing them.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

28 January. Students of the Institute of Superior Pedagogy (ISP) in Bukavu demonstrated against school and syllabus fees. The students burned tires and barricaded roads.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

Locals indicated that this group is also responsible for abductions in the area but provided no further details.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 21 January, in Mapobu, the  ADF attacked and killed 25 FARDC soldiers and injured 22 other. Additionally 5 soldiers were reported missing. The UN Group of Experts collected evidence that corroborated this information. During the same period, several sources witnessed a high number of injured ADF combatants brought back to ADF camps, indicating their involvement in attacks and clashes. FARDC seized a type 80 general purpose machine gun from an ADF combatant.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

notes: 17 December. Suspected Batende militia members attacked Nkolo 2, a Banunu community. Two naval officers attempted to repel the attackers, but one of the soldiers was killed and the other is missing. Much of the Nkolo 2 population had fled following the Yumbi city attack on 16/12. A MONUSCO investigation confirmed at least 10 fatalities in Nkolo 2. Homes, churches and schools were destroyed. Investigations found that the attacked on the Banunu were likely planned in advance.

actor1: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

source: Radio Okapi; AFP; UN HRC; MONUSCO
notes: 17 December. Following the attack on Yumbi city on 16/12, suspected Batende militia members attacked Bongende, Yumbi. The assailants mutilated the victims, removing limbs and sexual organs of men, women and children. Fetuses were cut out of pregnant women. At least one woman was raped and two children were reportedly abducted. A MONUSCO investigation confirmed 348 fatalities in Bongende, however, they suspected the actual number to be higher. Investigations found that the attacked on the Banunu were likely planned in advance and soldiers participated in the attacks on Bongende.

actor1: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Banunu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: AFP; UN HRC; MONUSCO; Radio Okapi
notes: 16 December. A group of 3,000 armed Batende attacked Yumbi city - particularly the neighborhoods of Noyi, Bolu, Likolo, and Ntsentseke. Local police members participated along the Batende (the head of the police had disarmed Banunu officers prior to the attack). Armed Banunu members retliated in some areas with support from a member of the naval forces. Civilians were shot, stabbed, mutilated, and burned to death; over 900 properties were damaged including homes, schools and churches. A MONUSCO investigation confirmed 170 fatalities, primarily from the Banunu community (the number may be higher due to uncounted bodies dumped into the river). The attack came after a communal dispute over the burial of the Banunu's customary chief on land belonging to Batende on 14/12. Local CSOs indicate that the group's political allegiances of the Batende with the FCC and Banunu with the Lamuka Coalition exacerbated the dispute.

notes: 11 December. Lamuka coalition supporters and police clashed in Lubumbashi amidst Fayulu's arrival for a campaign rally. Police fired tear gas and water cannons at supporters who had gathered around the city, including at Fayulu's motorcade. Fayulu's supporters burned vehicles. Police said they dispersed the Lamuka supporters for burning vehicles, while Fayulu's speakers report the police initiated it to prevent the Lamuka rally. Civil society organizations report at least one death by shooting (possibly two) and 43 injuries , while the police reported 13 injuries and denied any fatalities. The UN HRC reported three fatalities and several injuries.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: In October, the FARDC clashed with a Batwa militia in Tanganyika.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: During the month of October, Batwa militias raped and gang raped 17 women along the Kalemie-Kabulo-Kioko road in Tanganyika. The attacks often occurred as the group attacked villages. Coded as four incidents each week in October.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

15-17 October. The Association of Responsible Youth (AJR) protested against toll collection barriers set up by agents of the provincial executive on the roads of North Ubangi. On the third day, police dispersed the protest.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

09 October. Suspected ADF ambushed and killed two civilians in Kisiki-Maimoya on the Oisha-Eringeti National Highway No. 4 in Beni. FARDC intervened soon after, exchanging fire with the attackers (coded in a separate event).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 28 Sept 2018, the ADF raided Mukoko village of Beni territory. The FARDC repelled the attack. Six civilians were killed and one wounded.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 26 September. One person was shot dead in Kasindi, bordered with Uganda.

notes: On 25 September, in unspecified location [coded to Bangadi], a group of unidentified men with AK-47s reportedly looted houses late in the evening. They abducted a young woman and used her as a porter for looted goods. She remains unaccounted for and presumed still in captivity.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 25 September, near Bangadi, an unidentified armed group ambushed civilians on the road from Bangadi to Niangara, ordering some to purchase supplies in Bangadi. Local security forces arrested 1 of the victims under the suspicion that he was working with the armed group.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: 24 September. The FARDC clashed with an unidentified armed group in Makembi, Oicha. One soldier was killed.

notes: 24 September 2018. Students and LUCHA activist protested in Beni, over the insecurity in the region. A dead city was also observed. [size=approximately 100]

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 24 September. The Army regained control of a number of towns in and around Kilembwe in Fizi territory occupied for more than a week by a Mai-Mai militia led by Yakutumba (a coalition of Malaika and Alleluia militias). Yakutumba withdrew without a fight in the locality of Kilembwe. Coded as two separate events, one battle-gov regains, one non-violent transfer.

notes: 24 September. The Army regained control of a number of towns in and around Kilembwe in Fizi territory occupied for more than a week by a Mai-Mai militia led by Yakutumba (a coalition of Malaika and Alleluia militias). Yakutumba withdrew without a fight in the locality of Kilembwe. Coded as two separate events, one battle-gov regains, one non-violent transfer.

On 24 September 2018, in Oicha, ADF raided Bakaiku neighbourhood in Oicha rural district. They killed one person and abducted one adult and 16 children. The attackers also burned houses and looted cattle and property. Among assailants children aged 9 or 10 years old had been ordered to capture civilians.

notes: On 21 Sept 2018, the FARDC arrested and killed two young men in Katoro village of Rutshuru territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 September. Unidentified men abducted a one-year-old child from the Mapendo neighborhood in Goma town. The kidnappers killed the child.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 20-21 September. FARDC regained several territory from the Mai-Mai Yakutumba along the border between Maniema and South-Kivu over two days of fighting. On the first day, fighting in Tubangoyi (Sud-Kivu) left fatalities on both sides. The next day, clashes were reported in Kabeya (Maniema), Mai Ndombe (Sud-Kivu) and Kilembwe (Sud-Kivu). Coordinates of Tubangoyi and Mai Ndombe are approximates based on humanitarian maps.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 21 Sept 2018, alleged Mayi Mayi militants attacked an FARDC position at Rughenda district in Butembo town. Two people were killed and five were wounded.
20 September. LUCHA activists marched in the cities of Beni and Kasindi in Beni territory to demand the holding of credible and peaceful elections in the DRC.

actor1: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: On 20 Sept 2018, the CNRD raided Katsiru locality in Rutshuru territory, shooting a young man dead.
20 September. The Mai-Mai Kifuafua Delphin Mbaenda attacked and chased after the Mai-Mai Kirikicho and Shalio at Busurungi village in Walikale territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 20-21 September. FARDC regained several territory from the Mai-Mai Yakutumba along the border between Maniema and South-Kivu over two days of fighting. On the first day, fighting in Tubangoyi (Sud-Kivu) left fatalities on both sides. The next day, clashes were reported in Kabeya (Maniema), Mai Ndombe (Sud-Kivu) and Kilembwe (Sud-Kivu). Coordinates of Tubangoyi and Mai Ndombe are approximates based on humanitarian maps.

On 20 September, in Gongolo, a group of 6 presumed LRA entered the village and looted houses and a medical dispensary. They abducted a young boy before departing. Two days later, the same group was sighted 7 km north of Ngilima with 1 girl and 4 boys held captive.
20 September. LUCHA activists marched in the cities of Beni and Kasindi in Beni territory to demand the holding of credible and peaceful elections in the DRC.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 19 September. The commander of the Mayi-Mayi Yakutumba group, Dokis, was killed during heavy clashes with the military in Kipupu, South Kivu.
19 September 2019. Road construction workers demonstrated in front of Beni town hall, demanding their overdue wages. [size=approximately 100]

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 19 September. Five people were wounded, three seriously when police repressed a demonstration organised by the Civil Society Action Group (CCAC) in Kinshasa.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 18 September. The FARDC clashed with an unidentified armed group along the Mbau-Kamango road, Oicha. Two soldiers were killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 18 September. Five unknown gunmen were killed in clashes with the FARDC in Jiro, a town 62 kilometers north of Bunia in the Walendu Tatsi Sector of Djugu Territory (approx. Coordinates used).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 18 September. Mayi Mayi killed 15 FARDC soldiers in a battle at Mutombo (15 km north of Minembwe)

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 18 September. A person was killed during the attack on an FARDC position by alleged ADF rebels in Kokola, about 40km north of the city of Beni (North Kivu).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 17 September, in Mayawa, a group of 10 armed men entered the village and looted 3 homes of their potatoes, poultry, groundnuts, and other food. They reportedly wore military and civilian clothes and spoke broken Lingala and an unrecognized language. They departed west.
17 September. Two armed LRA combatants abducted a young girl 30 km south of Bangadi.
17 September. Two LRA combatants ambushed and looted two men 30km south of Bangadi.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 17 September. Unidentified gunmen raided Rubaya village in Masisi territory. The attackers killed a policeman, a man and a woman. They also injured four people.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 17 September. Renewed clashes between the FARDC and Mayi-Mayi coalition groups in Kilembwe, in the territory of Fizi.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 17 September. The Raia Mutomboki Kizamoto coalition leader was shot dead in clashes with the FARDC in the Bamuguba grouping in Shabunda territory (South Kivu).

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
notes: On 17 Sept 2018, the FDLR-RUD raided a house in Buganza village in Rutshuru territory at night. The attackers shot and killed a 42-year-old man.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 16 September. An unidentified armed group attacked Kididiwe, Beni (coordinates are approximate). No further details available.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Prison Guards
notes: 16 September. The Director of Rutshuru Prison and his wife were killed in their home by unidentified gunmen in Kiwanja City, about 70 km north of Goma.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Kuluna Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 16 September 2018. At approximately 4 am, police forces took a man from his house in Kinshasa. The next morning the man's body, along with two other bodies were discovered. Two of the victims belonged to the Kuluna. All of the victims appeared to be strangled.
On 16 September, near Mbiangu, 15 men armed with AK-47s suspected to be LRA, looted civilians along the Kapili-Kana road. The assailants, who spoke Arabic and broken Lingala, abducted 1 boy.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 15 September (on or around). In mid-September, the ADF overtook the FARDC base in Kididiwe (coordinates approximate), in the Mayangose region. Much of the local population fled the area following the ADF's occupation.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 15 September (on or around). In mid-September, the ADF overtook the FARDC base at Point 46/Malolu in the Mayangose region (no coordinates available, in the Beni territory north of Beni city). Much of the local population fled the area following the ADF's occupation.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: 15 September. The FARDC went to support the Burundian army at Gatumba border post during a RED TABARA attack. During the attackers' retreat, they killed three FARDC soldiers and two children on Congolese soil in the rural commune of Uvira.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 15 September. Eleven people, including one soldier, were killed in attacks by a Lendu ethnic militia on FARDC naval forces' positions in Muvaramu, Songamoya and Tara in Djugu territory (Ituri) between 15-16 September (later reports indicated 15 fatalities). Approximately 30 people were abducted during the attacks. Eleven fatalities spread across the three locations. Approx. Coordinates used for all locations at around 80km north of Bunia along the Lake Albert.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Kuluna Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Men (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 September. Between 2 and 4 am, police apprehended seven males, including teenagers, from the Kauka neighborhood of Kalamu. Five of the detainees were found dead the following day, at least one of the victim's genitals were cut off. The two others were forcibly disappeared. The attack is believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 15 September. At least 10 people were seriously injured in a clash between security forces and alleged Tshiyoyo militiamen in Tshipidinga locality, in the vicinity of Kananga airport.
14 September. NDC-R captured Pitakongo (Bitakongo) from Mai-Mai
14 September. FNL attacked a Burundian border post. Two FNL forces and one Burundian soldier killed. Percise place at border not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 14 Sept 2018, the FARDC shot and killed a woman and her teenage son in Kibirizi locality of Rutshuru territory.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 14 Sept 2018, the Mai-Mai Mazembe ambushed an FARDC convoy near Kabuhendo village in Rutshuru territory. One FARDC soldier as well as two civilians were killed and four other civilians were wounded.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 13 September. Five unidentified gunmen raided a house in the Mangodomu neighborhood of Mangina rural district. The attackers shot and killed a 32-year-old man.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 12 September. A police officer was killed Wednesday (September 12th) in Maboya in Beni territory in an attack attributed to the Mai-Mai.

On 12 September, near Bangadi, 6 armed LRA combatants looted 2 cyclists and 1 doctor of their money, vaccines, and other goods along the Nambia Ngbangala-Bangadi road. They also kidnapped 3 men and 1 young boy, releasing the 3 men the following day, keeping the boy captive.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 12 September. An alleged FRPI militiamen shot and killed a student in the village called "Supreme", located 93 kilometers south of Bunia in the Walendu Bindi chiefdom in Irumu territory.
12 September. DR Congo's navy on Wednesday accused Ugandan troops of killing four Congolese fishermen after their bodies surfaced on Lake Edward.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 12 Sept 2018, the FDLR-FOCA ambushed an FARDC convoy at Virunga Park near Bugomba village in Rutshuru territory. Four FARDC soldiers and two civilians were killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Movement of forces: 10 September. The Armed Forces of the DRC deployed a unit in Butale. The deployment is due to a recent visit of an area chief

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. An unidentified armed group clashed with the FARDC in Mavivi, Oicha. Five fatalities were reported during attacks in Mavivi, Matembo, Nzuma, and Ngadi. The fatalities have been spread among the locations (3 events).

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On 9 Sept 2018, the ADF raided Nzuma and Ngadi neighborhoods of Beni town. FARDC, with support of MONUSCO peacekeepers, counter-attacked. The ADF killed a man and one house was destroyed by a bomb.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. Republican Guard soldier was arrested for shooting a civilian at the public port of Goma (North Kivu). The victim was shot and wounded as he opened the door from his home to answer the call of soldiers. Motives unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. Two agents of the Congolese Institute for the Conservation of Nature were seriously injured during an ambush held on their convoy by suspected LRA rebels in Banda, an area in Dikuma.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. An unidentified armed group clashed with the FARDC in Matembo. Five fatalities were reported during attacks in Mavivi, Matembo, Nzuma, and Ngadi. The fatalities have been spread among the locations (3 events).

actor1: Bakwa Ndaye Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 09 September 2018 (on or around). During the weekend, communal tensions broke out in the Katende area, as Bakwa Ndaye assaulted over 50 members of a different ethnic group. Five houses, as well as other property, was destroyed.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) National Intelligence Agency
notes: 09 September. Police shoot and member of the National Intelligence Agency in Bendera during an altercation.

08-09 September. Masudi Alimasi Kokodikoko's Raia Mutomboki forces abducted seventeen women and girls (age 15-70) in the Shabunda territory. The group then held the women in a cave for four days, where they subjected them to rape and other forms of sexual violence. Kokodikoko raped at least nine of the women.

08 September. Twenty people were seriously injured, shops and houses looted and many other material damage reported during the skirmishes in the evening at Balese neighbourhood in Mangobo commune in Kisangani. The unrest stemmed from a dispute between the Kata motorcycle youth association of the Matete district and the Bourgeois youth association of the Balese district.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On or before 07 September. The Raia Mutomboki Kokodikoko shot and killed a policeman in Bulumbu village in Bamuguba Sud grouping, east Shabunda (coordinate approx. based on source map). The policeman killed was the commander of the Kigulube police station.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 07 September 2018. The FRPI looted Banikonza, Bandikama and Batine, Ituri (no coordinates available, located next to Nyakunde town).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 7 Sept 2018, the FARDC shot and killed a man in Kakomero village of Rutshuru territory. The FARDC suspected the victim from being a Nyatura fighter.
06 September 2018. A suspected robber was caught and lynched by a mob in Matadi.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 05 September. Clashes between the FARDC and Nyatura fighters left at least two civilians killed and five seriously injured in the town of Rugari, Rutshuru territory, North Kivu. Among the wounded, there are two soldiers. Later reports indicate four fatalities. The military indicated that the assailants were FDLR fighters, not Nyatura combatants.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 04 September. At least 23 peaceful protesters were injured, six of them severely, while another 89 were arrested in the capital Kinshasa, and in Goma, Lubumbashi, Bukavu, Mbandaka, Mbuji-Mayi and Tshikapa as police violently dispersed peaceful protests on the use of electronic voting machines in the upcoming elections slated for 23 December. Among the arrested were seven LUCHA activists, they were released the following day.

actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 03 September. An unidentified armed group ambushed a MONUSCO convoy along the Mavivi-Boikene road. Two peacekeepers were injured.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 03 September. Fifteen activists from the Citizen's Struggle for Change movement (LUCHA) were wounded and admitted to the hospital as police dispersed a march initiated by the movement in Goma. During the demonstration, three local journalists were assaulted by the police.

actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 03 September. Two MONUSCO peacekeepers, two soldiers and two civilians were injured during an ADF ambush in the Ngadi area. Two civilians were also abducted but later escaped.

assoc_actor_2: Mbororo Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 3 September, in Mugalie, an LRA group looted a Peuhl campsite of the food, money, and other goods.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 03 September. The ADF attacked a FARDC position in Ngadi, about 12 km from the centre of Beni city near the Rwenzori forest but they were repelled. Loyalist forces repelled them after violent clashes. Civil society claims that several assets of the population were looted by the alleged ADF during this attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On or before 03 September. The FARDC attacked unidentified gunmen who wanted to occupy the Luziba mine site in Lumbishi village in Kalehe territory.
On 2 September, an LRA group of 5 men and 3 boys in military and civilian attire, ambushed civilians in a field 4 km northeast of Kpegu. They looted the victims and abducted 2 men and 1 girl.
02 September 2018. Mayi Mayi Simba attacked the Nia Nia mines. Three people were killed. The assailants looted goods and abducted civilians to carry the goods. The abductees were later released.

actor2: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: 02 September. The Nyatura Love attacked two CNRD positions simultaneously in Lubwe and Kitunda villages in Rutshuru territory. One CNRD soldier was killed (fatality coded in Kitunda)

actor2: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: 02 September. The Nyatura Love attacked two CNRD positions simultaneously in Lubwe and Kitunda villages in Rutshuru territory. One CNRD soldier was killed (fatality coded in Kitunda)

On 2 September, near Dikumba, 20 LRA members looted houses and abducted 1 man and 2 girls. They released the man 12 km northwest of Dikuma later that day. The 2 girls remain unaccounted for and presumed in captivity.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 1 Sept 2018, the Nyatura FDP and FDLR-FOCA attacked an FARDC position in Machazo village of Rutshuru territory. One civilian was killed while two FARDC soldiers and three civilians were wounded. Looting of civilian property also ocurred.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 01 September 2018. Police forces intervened in a Together for Change political rally in Lubumbashi. One person was killed and at least nine others were arrested. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: MLC: Movement for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 01 September. Militants of the Mouvement de liberation du Congo and those of the Common Front for Congo (FCC) threw stones at each other and clashed as they gathered to greet their respective delegations at the Gemena airport (South Ubangi). The MLC militants began throwing stones at the FCC ones after learning that their delegation would not land in Gemena.
31 August. 18 people kidnapped as LRA attacked Sili village in Ango territory (Bas-Uele).
31 August. Five people were killed by suspected ADF rebels in Kakuka at the border with Ituri.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 or 31 August. An unidentified armed group attacked Masuluwede (no coordinates available), near Ngite. One civilian was injured.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 30 Aug 2018, the ADF attacked FARDC positions in Kinyamubiri in Beni territory. The clashes lasted over twelve hours. Two men were wounded.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 or 31 August. Suspected ADF militants attacked Kingamuviri, Kitismba, Kakuka, and Sayo in Beni and Oicha territories. During the attacks, one soldier and five civilians were killed. The five civilian fatalities reportedly occurred in Kakuka. One person was also raped and 2 others were injured. It is unclear in which town(s) the confrontation with the soldier and rape occurred - these were spread across event locations.

notes: 30 August. Suspected ADF militants attacked Kingamuviri, Kitismba, Kakuka, and Sayo in Beni and Oicha territories. During the attacks, one soldier and five civilians were killed. On 29 Aug 2018, the NDC-R shot and killed a man in Mera village in North Kivu territory. The attackers suspected the victim to be an NDC Sheka informant.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 29 Aug 2018, the FARDC shot and killed a 24-year-old man in Tinge village in Beni territory. They accused the victim of being a Mai-Mai.

29 August. The vice president of the youth of the locality of Mera in the territory of Walikale (North Kivu) was murdered by alleged Mai-Mai fighters of the NDC-Renovated Mwissa Shirirayi, aka Guidon in Kibua.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 27 August - on or about. Elements of the NDC / Renove tried to enter the agglomeration of Kasugho in the south of Lubero territory (North Kivu) but were repulsed by the army. At least 4 of their elements were killed and another captured.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 27 August 2018. An angry mob attacked the health center and police station in Bela. The riot occurred after the death of a woman who had been transferred to an Ebola center in another town. Police intervened and fired shots to disperse the demonstrators. Two police officers were injured. [size=no report]

27 August. The militiamen of the Nduma defence of Congo (NDC / Renove) movement attacked the Mai-Mai Mazembe in the Pitakongo village in the south of Lubero territory (North Kivu). NDC won after a 2h battle. Some dead and wounded reported. The village had been under Mazembe control for the last three years. Unknown casualties coded as 5.
27 August. 21 people kidnapped as LRA attacked Sili village in Ango territory (Bas-Uele).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 26 August 2018. Two FARDC soldiers were ambushed and beheaded by Lendu militias in Ladejo or Wassa, Djugu. Another source reported the location as Wassa.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Lendu Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 26 August. FARDC looted Lendu civilians in Djailo

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Lendu Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 26 August. FARDC looted Lendu civilians in Loko

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 26 August 2018. An unidentified armed group ambushed two men - including a journalist - in the Rutshuru territory. The assailants assaulted one of the men before abducting the journalist.
26 August. LRA elements killed two policemen in the town of Banda in Bas-Uele before taking 30 people hostage. Coded as two separate events.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 26 August. LRA elements killed two policemen in the town of Banda in Bas-Uele before taking 30 people hostage. Coded as two separate events.
25 August 2018. Two Angolan soldiers raped a woman in the bush in Kamako. Police intervened and captured one assailant, while the other fled across the border.
